TopicTitle: New planet pack suggestion: Interstellar Defense planets rejiggered with moons

Articles.Content:
Hi, every solar system mod-maker out there, (especially ProtoJeb21) please can I request a new mod to be made (And to persuade KottabosGames to check it out when its done!)? No offense, it's just because I don't know how to make new solar systems. There are 5 new solar systems, but you can add them one by one. Thanks! Also, I'll submit the equatorial radius, to make things easier. Also, this mod is called Interstellar Defense planets rejiggered with moons, because the stars and planets are from a game called Interstellar Defence. I modified each one a bit , placed them with different stars and also added moons. I also modified the stars to be more realistic. Thanks for your consideration, and hope to see these enter KSP soon! 

The key:

No hyphens: star

1 hyphen (-): planet

2 hyphens (--): moon

1. Alpha R24 system

Spoiler

Chaos: A yellow-white main-sequence star slightly larger and hotter than Kerbol. Spectral type F7.7V. Located 13.5 Tm from Kerbol. 293,307km

-Eudora: A warm very blue gas dwarf rich in methane. 1,876km

--Skyler: A barren brown rocky moon orbiting very far away from Eudora, but still within its hill sphere. 53km

-Neva: A large dwarf planet orbiting very, very far away from Chaos. 248km

2. Cygnus R10 system (Please add this one first)

Spoiler

Tartarus: A very large red dwarf. So large and hot in fact, that it is tinted slightly orange, but it is still reddish. Spectral type M0.3Ve. Located 8.9 Tm from Kerbol.122,916km

-Nyx: A hot tidally locked rocky planet rich in metals. Relatively close to Tartarus. 792km

-Taj: A temperate planet with a nitrogen atmosphere and with a ton of rare minerals and metals. 854km

-Theron: A greyish chlorine planet covered in a methane atmosphere, which makes it look slightly bluish. Astronomers don't have a clue why a chlorine planet would boast such an atmosphere. 931km

--Etem: A small ice moon with a GIGANTIC impact crater. 22km

-Midori: A small gas dwarf with such a enormous amount of radioactive material that it's green! 2,033km

--Echo: An asteroid orbiting very close to Midori. Its long exposure to radioactivity has turned it purple! 12km

--Daphnis: A captured dwarf planet with a small ring. 91km

-Hypatos: A dark red and cream gas giant with a lot of bands and some small storms. Has a large shiny metallic silver ring quite close to the planet. 4,643km

--Didon: The primary shepherd moon of Hypatos, it is roughly spherical. 16km

--Alauda: A very smooth ice moon. 72km

--Amphitrite: A Titan(The moon of Saturn, not the gas giant in one of the other solar systems!) analogue with a green atmosphere. It has some unicellular and multicellular life. It is on a slightly inclined orbit and has some of the best views of this mod. 257km

-Gul: A gigantic rocky planet in the far reaches of the system. Glows because of radioactive material. 1,249km

--Hector: An ocean moon dimly lit by Gul's light. Heated by tidal friction. 205km 

 

3. Kepler R26 system

Spoiler

Erebus: A very light blue A-type star. Spectral type: A8.6V. Located 16.7 Tm from Kerbol. 392,026km

Cronus: A small hot orange-black gas giant that is slowly evaporating away. 2,876km

Erebus has an asteroid belt. 

4. Europa R12 system

Spoiler

Pontus: A Kerbol-esk star that rotates very quickly, causing it to slightly flatten. Spectral type: G2.5V. Located 22.8 Tm from Kerbol. 258,397km

-Kleon: A yellowish desert mega-kerbin, Kleon is nearly twice the size of Kerbin. Has a very thick purple ozone atmosphere. 1,143km

--Lachesis: A captured asteroid. 11km

-Xenia: A habitable planet with a ton of plants. It has so much that you can't tell oceans from land, as life has turned each into a green colour.

 

5. Fermi R25 system (please do this one after Cygnus R10)

Spoiler

Gaia: A yellow-orange star slightly smaller than Kerbol. Spectral type K4.7Ve. Located 19.2 Tm from Kerbol. 198,134km

-Hades: A dark lava planet covered in red and orange lakes of molten rock. 493km

-Kal: A dry brownish barren rocky planet. Has a lot of craters. 607km

--Baranen: A small moon made predominantly of alkali metals, causing it to appear very white in colour. 42km

-Hestia: A dense planet made predominantly of iron. Its also rich in phosphorus, giving it its reddish tinge. 656km

--Edis: A very rusty moon. 34km

-Nereus: A smaller version of Kerbin, Nereus has sky blue oceans and very diverse landmass colour, ranging from grass green to yellow to brown. 529km

--Hebe: A moon similar to the Mun. 102km

-Solon: A cold super-kerbin with dark streaks. Has a small ring. 923km

-Titan: A large dark-tan Jool-esk gas giant with a very magnetic core. No rings. 7,346km

--Lutetia: A very active moon with lava lakes and sulphur patches. 97km

--Diotime: An ice moon with an underwater ocean and magenta-ish streaks. 48km

--Themis: An old, dark moon with an eccentric orbit. 123km

--Bamberga: A captured asteroid, it has a very eccentric and inclined orbit. 9km

 

These are all the systems Interstellar Defense planets rejiggered with moons should add in! If you like the suggestions, you could start making this mod, and if you do, please let me know, thanks!
